name: Titanium.UI.Picker
summary: A control used to select one or more fixed values.

events.name: click
events.summary: Fired when the device detects a click against the view.
events.description: This event is only available for non-spinner plain pickers.

properties.name: x
properties.summary: X coordinate of the event from the source view's coordinate system.

properties.name: y
properties.summary: Y coordinate of the event from the source view's coordinate system.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

events.name: change
events.summary: Fired when the value of any column's row is changed.

properties.name: columnIndex
properties.summary: Selected column index. On iOS, only applicable to PICKER_TYPE_PLAIN picker types.

properties.name: rowIndex
properties.summary: Selected row index. On iOS, only applicable to PICKER_TYPE_PLAIN picker types.

properties.name: column
properties.summary: The column object. On iOS, only applicable to PICKER_TYPE_PLAIN picker types.

properties.name: countDownDuration
properties.summary: The selected duration in milliseconds. Applicable to PICKER_TYPE_COUNT_DOWN_TIMER picker types.

properties.name: value
properties.summary: The selected value. Applicable to date/time pickers only. This property is read-only on Android.

properties.name: row
properties.summary: The row object. On iOS, only applicable to PICKER_TYPE_PLAIN picker types.

properties.name: selectedValue
properties.summary: Array of selected values, one element per column in the picker. Applicable to PICKER_TYPE_PLAIN picker types.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

methods.name: add
methods.summary: Adds rows or columns to the picker.
methods.description: Once you use this method to add rows and columns to a picker, you cannot remove or manipulate them.

parameters.name: data
parameters.summary: A row, set of rows, a column of rows or a set of columns of rows. When this method is used to add a row or set of rows, a single-column picker is created.

methods.name: getSelectedRow
methods.summary: Gets the selected row for a column, or null if none exists.

methods.name: setSelectedRow
methods.description: On iOS, this method must be called after the picker is rendered. On Android, the picker has a default value of 0 for both column and row index.

parameters.name: animated
parameters.summary: Determines whether the selection should be animated. (iPhone, iPad-only)

methods.name: setValue
methods.summary: Sets the date and time value property for Date pickers.

methods.name: showDatePickerDialog
methods.summary: Shows Date picker as a modal dialog.
methods.description:
Applicable to the PICKER_TYPE_DATE picker type.

See "Date Picker using showDatePickerDialog()" for an example.

parameters.name: dictObj
parameters.summary: Dictionary object with a subset of Titanium.UI.Picker properties and a callback defined. Acceptable object properties are callback, title and value. Property okButtonTitle is only supported on Titanium versions older than 10.0.0.

methods.name: showTimePickerDialog
methods.summary: Shows Time picker as a modal dialog.
methods.description:
Applicable to the PICKER_TYPE_TIME picker type.

See "Date Picker using showDatePickerDialog()" for a similar example.

parameters.name: dictObj
parameters.summary: Dictionary object with a subset of Titanium.UI.Picker properties and a callback defined. Acceptable object properties are callback, format24, title and value. Property okButtonTitle is only supported on Titanium versions older than 10.0.0.

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.summary: Background color of the picker, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description: For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: calendarViewShown
properties.summary: Determines whether the calenderView is visible.

properties.name: columns
properties.summary: Columns used for this picker, as an array of Titanium.UI.PickerColumn objects.
properties.description:
You can only set columns for the plain picker. If you set the type to anything else except Titanium.UI.PICKER_TYPE_PLAIN, you cannot modify the columns.

In an Alloy application you can specify this property with a <PickerColumn> (or <Column>) element that contains one or more <PickerRow> (or <Row>) elements, as shown below:

<Alloy>
    <Window>
        <Picker useSpinner="true">
            <PickerColumn id="column1">
                <PickerRow title="Bananas"/>
                <PickerRow title="Strawberries"/>
                <PickerRow title="Mangos"/>
            </PickerColumn>
            <!-- Picker shorthand notation -->
            <Column id="column2">
                <Row title="red"/>
                <Row title="green"/>
                <Row title="blue"/>
            </Column>
        </Picker>
    </Window>
</Alloy>

properties.name: countDownDuration
properties.summary: Duration in milliseconds used for a Countdown Timer picker.

properties.name: datePickerStyle
properties.summary: Request a style if the picker is a date picker (PICKER_TYPE_DATE).
properties.description: If the style changed, then the date picker may need to be resized and will generate a layout pass to display correctly.

properties.name: dateTimeColor
properties.summary: Sets the text color of date- and time-pickers.
properties.description:
Applicable to PICKER_TYPE_TIME and PICKER_TYPE_DATE_AND_TIME picker types. The picker type PICKER_TYPE_DATE does not support text customizing as stated in the UIKit User Interface Catalog.

Important: On iOS 14+, you also have to set the datePickerStyle to DATE_PICKER_STYLE_WHEELS in order to use this property.

properties.name: font
properties.summary: Font to use for text.
properties.description: Only applicable to PICKER_TYPE_DATE and PICKER_TYPE_TIME picker types for android. For PICKER_TYPE_PLAIN, refer to Titanium.UI.PickerColumn for android, and Titanium.UI.PickerRow for iphone / ipad.

properties.name: format24
properties.summary: Determines whether the Time pickers display in 24-hour or 12-hour clock format.
properties.description:
Applicable to PICKER_TYPE_TIME and PICKER_TYPE_DATE_AND_TIME picker types.

When this property is enabled, a time picker is displayed with hours 0 through 23, or with hours 1 through 12 and am/pm controls otherwise.

For backward compatibility, the default value of this property depends on the style of picker in use.

For a spinner picker (when useSpinner is true), this defaults to true (24-hour format.) For a native picker (when useSpinner is either un-set or false), this defaults to false (12-hour format.)

The value of this property may be modified even after a picker is rendered and the UI will be updated accordingly.

properties.name: locale
properties.summary: Locale used when displaying Date and Time picker values.
properties.description:
Applicable to PICKER_TYPE_DATE, PICKER_TYPE_TIME and PICKER_TYPE_DATE_AND_TIME picker types.

Locale must be represented as a combination of ISO 2-letter language and country codes. For example, en-US or en-GB. See the ISO 639-1 and ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 sections of wikipedia for reference.

On iOS, the system locale is always used.

properties.name: maxDate
properties.summary: Maximum date displayed when a Date picker is in use.
properties.description:
Applicable to PICKER_TYPE_DATE and PICKER_TYPE_DATE_AND_TIME picker types.

For JavaScript files, use a JavaScript Date object.

For Alloy XML and TSS files, use a date string that can be parsed by the moment.js constructor, which includes ISO-8601 and RFC2822 dates.

This property is ignored when maxDate is less than minDate.

properties.name: minDate
properties.summary: Minimum date displayed when a Date picker is in use.
properties.description:
Applicable to PICKER_TYPE_DATE and PICKER_TYPE_DATE_AND_TIME picker types.

For JavaScript files, use a JavaScript Date object.

For Alloy XML and TSS files, use a date string that can be parsed by the moment.js constructor, which includes ISO-8601 and RFC2822 dates.

This property is ignored when maxDate is less than minDate.

properties.name: minuteInterval
properties.summary: Interval in minutes displayed when one of the Time types of pickers is in use.
properties.description:
Applicable to PICKER_TYPE_TIME and PICKER_TYPE_DATE_AND_TIME picker types.

The minimum permitted value is 1 and maximum is 30. If the value cannot be evenly divided into 60, the default value is used.

properties.name: nativeSpinner
properties.summary: Creates a native Android control for creating a Time Spinner with Type Ti.UI.PICKER_TYPE_TIME. This is invoked rather than the default native "dropdown" style.
properties.description:
If true, the nativeSpinner is enabled.

This property should be set either at picker creation, i.e. Titanium.UI.createPicker({ nativeSpinner:true });, or before the picker is added to its parent.

Example as follows:

var picker = Ti.UI.createPicker({
    type: Ti.UI.PICKER_TYPE_TIME,
    nativeSpinner: true,
    format24: false,
    minuteInterval: 4,
    minDate: new Date(2018, 5, 24),
    maxDate: new Date(2020, 5, 24),
    value: new Date(2019, 5, 24)
});

properties.name: selectionIndicator
properties.summary: Determines whether the visual selection indicator is shown.
properties.description:
If true, selection indicator is enabled.

Since iOS 7 and later you cannot customize the picker view's selection indicator. The selection indicator is always shown, so setting this property to false has no effect.

properties.name: selectionOpens
properties.summary: Determines whether calling the method setSelectedRow opens when called
properties.description:
If true, selection will open when setSelectedRow is called.

If false, selection will not open when setSelectedRow is called.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Determines the type of picker displayed
properties.description:
You can only set columns for the plain picker. If you set the type to anything else except Titanium.UI.PICKER_TYPE_PLAIN, you cannot modify the columns.

PICKER_TYPE_DATE_AND_TIME is only available for iOS. PICKER_TYPE_COUNT_DOWN_TIMER is only available for iOS.

properties.name: useSpinner

deprecated.notes: This property is deprecated. Please use the default native "dropdown" style.

properties.summary: Determines whether the non-native Android control, with a spinning wheel that looks and behaves like the iOS picker, is invoked rather than the default native "dropdown" style.
properties.description:
If true, the spinner is enabled.

This property should be set either at picker creation, i.e. Titanium.UI.createPicker({ useSpinner:true });, or before the picker is added to its parent.

This property must be enabled for multi-column pickers.

properties.name: value
properties.summary: Date and time value for Date and Time pickers.
properties.description:
Applicable to PICKER_TYPE_DATE, PICKER_TYPE_TIME and PICKER_TYPE_DATE_AND_TIME picker types.

For JavaScript files, use a JavaScript Date object.

For Alloy XML and TSS files, use a date string that can be parsed by the moment.js constructor, which includes ISO-8601 and RFC2822 dates.

properties.name: visibleItems
properties.summary: Number of visible rows to display. This is only applicable to a plain picker and when the useSpinner is true.
properties.description: The spinner-style Android picker shows 5 rows by default; one selected in the middle and 2 above and below. Set to an odd number to ensure the selected row is in the middle.
